docs.snippet: Columbia University yesterday cited the President of Uruguay, Luis Batlle Berres, as a journalist, statesman and "dedicated servant of his people since the days of his youth."

headline.main: COLUMBIA HONORS HEAD OF URUGUAY; Luis Batlle Berres ls Cited as Journalist and Statesman --Fordham Degree Today

docs.snippet: President Luis Batlle Berres, the chairman of the National Council of Uruguay, became a sightseer for five minutes yesterday afternoon. For the rest of the day, however, he was the center of attention on a round of official calls.

headline.main: URUGUAY'S CHIEF KEPT ON GO HERE; Says He Came to U.S. to Seek Lifting of Trade Barriers, Not to Borrow Money

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12--President Eisenhower engaged today in his longest work day since his Sept. 24 heart attack.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12--President Eisenhower engaged today in his longest work day since his Sept. 24 heart attack.
docs.abstract: Pres has longest work day since attack, White House legis conf with Cong leaders; takes 3-hr break in midday for lunch and nap; Reprs Halleck, Arenas, Sen Knowland comment on appearance

headline.main: EISENHOWER WORKS 7 1/2 HOURS AT DESK; 3-Hour Break Interrupts His Longest Business Day EISENHOWER WORKS FULL DAY AT DESK

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Dec. 14 (AP) -- President Luis Batlle Berres of Uruguay was taken ill at a dinner in his honor here tonight. Officials reported he would be hospitalized "for a few days."
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Dec. 14 (AP) -- President Luis Batlle Berres of Uruguay was taken ill at a dinner in his honor here tonight. Officials reported he would be hospitalized "for a few days."
docs.abstract: taken ill at Chicago dinner; to be in hosp for few days; condition good

headline.main: URUGUAYAN HEAD IS ILL IN CHICAGO; Batlle Berres Is Stricken at Fete in His Honor -- To Be Hospitalized 'Few Days'

byline.original: By EDWIN L. DALE Jr.Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Dec. 15--Luis Batlle Berres, President of Uruguay, "spent a very restful night" at Wesley Memorial Hospital. Senor Batlle Berres, who is on a tour of the United States, was taken to the hospital last night after collapsing at a dinner in his...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Dec. 15--Luis Batlle Berres, President of Uruguay, "spent a very restful night" at Wesley Memorial Hospital. Senor Batlle Berres, who is on a tour of the United States, was taken to the hospital last night after collapsing at a dinner in his honor at the Chicago Club.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 16 -- The United Nations General Assembly tonight extended its tenth session until midnight Tuesday after having rejected a proposal for breaking the deadlock over a Security Council seat.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 16 -- The United Nations General Assembly tonight extended its tenth session until midnight Tuesday after having rejected a proposal for breaking the deadlock over a Security Council seat.
docs.abstract: Assembly rejects Maza proposal that Yugoslavia and Philippines split 2-yr term; 2 nations willing; Yugoslavia would serve 1st yr; Lodge, Dixon, Alphand back proposal; Kuznetsov opposed; proposal offered after 35th ballot fails to break deadlock

headline.main: U.N. Bars Drawing of Lots To End Council Seat Snag; DRAWING FOR SEAT AT U. N. REJECTED
